title: Our staff threatened with guns, shovels—Abuja electricity company
text:
Home » News » Our staff threatened with guns, shovels—Abuja electricity company Our staff threatened with guns, shovels—Abuja electricity company On 1:52 am In News by Okogba Comments 
By Chris Ochayi 
T he management of Abuja Electricity Distribution, AEDC, Plc, has expressed concern over increasing attacks on its field workers, which it described as unwarranted, vicious, inhuman and criminal. 
It said no action of AEDC Plc staff on their legitimate job warrants the use of bullets and shovel to threaten them, especially where there are redress mechanisms in place by the Nigerian Electricity Regulatory Commission and AEDC Plc. 
In a statement by AEDC yesterday in Abuja, it also disclosed that its management had petitioned the Inspector General against the Divisional Police Officer in Kubwa, Abuja, for what it described as the unprofessional way he handled a case of assault and threat to the lives of three AED Plc staff.
